void I2C_AckCmd ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or Disable I2C sending acknowledgement.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 304 of file ht32f5xxxx_i2c.c.

void I2C_AddressMaskConfig ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
u32  I2C_Mask 
)

This function is used to determine the prescaler of I2C timeout value.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
I2C_Mask,:specify the bit position of I2C slave address to be masked. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • I2C_MASKBIT_0 : Bit 0 of I2C slave address is masked
  • I2C_MASKBIT_1 : Bit 1 of I2C slave address is masked
  • I2C_MASKBIT_2 : Bit 2 of I2C slave address is masked
  • I2C_MASKBIT_3 : Bit 3 of I2C slave address is masked
  • I2C_MASKBIT_4 : Bit 4 of I2C slave address is masked
  • I2C_MASKBIT_5 : Bit 5 of I2C slave address is masked
  • I2C_MASKBIT_6 : Bit 6 of I2C slave address is masked
  • I2C_MASKBIT_7 : Bit 7 of I2C slave address is masked
  • I2C_MASKBIT_8 : Bit 8 of I2C slave address is masked
  • I2C_MASKBIT_9 : Bit 9 of I2C slave address is masked
Return values:
None

Definition at line 728 of file ht32f5xxxx_i2c.c.

ErrStatus I2C_CheckStatus ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
u32  I2C_Status 
)

Check whether the specified I2C status has been active.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
I2C_Status,:specify the flag that is to be check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • I2C_MASTER_SEND_START
  • I2C_MASTER_RECEIVER_MODE
  • I2C_MASTER_TRANSMITTER_MODE
  • I2C_MASTER_RX_NOT_EMPTY
  • I2C_MASTER_RX_NOT_EMPTY_NOBUSY
  • I2C_MASTER_TX_EMPTY
  • I2C_MASTER_RX_BUFFER_FULL
  • I2C_SLAVE_ACK_TRANSMITTER_ADDRESS
  • I2C_SLAVE_ACK_RECEIVER_ADDRESS
  • I2C_SLAVE_ACK_GCALL_ADDRESS
  • I2C_SLAVE_RX_NOT_EMPTY
  • I2C_SLAVE_RX_NOT_EMPTY_STOP
  • I2C_SLAVE_TX_EMPTY
  • I2C_SLAVE_RX_BUFFER_FULL
  • I2C_SLAVE_RECEIVED_NACK
  • I2C_SLAVE_RECEIVED_NACK_STOP
  • I2C_SLAVE_STOP_DETECTED
Return values:
SUCCESSor ERROR

Definition at line 532 of file ht32f5xxxx_i2c.c.

void I2C_ClearFlag ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
u32  I2C_Flag 
)

Clear the specified I2C flag.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
I2C_Flag,:specify the flag that is to be cleared. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • I2C_FLAG_ARBLOS : I2C arbitration flag
  • I2C_FLAG_RXNACK : I2C receive not acknowledge flag
  • I2C_FLAG_BUSERR : I2C Bus error flag
Return values:
None

Definition at line 743 of file ht32f5xxxx_i2c.c.

FlagStatus I2C_GetFlagStatus ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
u32  I2C_Flag 
)

Check whether the specified I2C flag has been set.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
I2C_Flag,:specify the flag to be check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • I2C_FLAG_STA : I2C start condition transmitted flag (Master mode)
  • I2C_FLAG_STO : I2C stop condition detected flag (Slave flag)
  • I2C_FLAG_ADRS : I2C address flag
  • I2C_FLAG_GCS : I2C general call flag (Slave mode)
  • I2C_FLAG_ARBLOS : I2C arbitration loss flag (Master mode)
  • I2C_FLAG_RXNACK : I2C received not acknowledge flag
  • I2C_FLAG_BUSERR : I2C bus error flag
  • I2C_FLAG_RXDNE : I2C Rx data not empty flag
  • I2C_FLAG_TXDE : I2C Tx data empty flag
  • I2C_FLAG_RXBF : I2C RX buffer full flag
  • I2C_FLAG_BUSBUSY : I2C bus busy flag
  • I2C_FLAG_MASTER : I2C master mode flag (Master flag)
  • I2C_FLAG_TXNRX : I2C transmitter mode flag
Return values:
SETor RESET

I2C_InitTypeDef *  I2C_InitStruct 
)

I2C_InitStruct,:pointer to a I2C_InitTypeDef structure.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 121 of file ht32f5xxxx_i2c.c.

void I2C_IntConfig ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
u32  I2C_Int,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or Disable I2C interrupts.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
I2C_Int,:specify if the I2C interrupt source to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • I2C_INT_STA
  • I2C_INT_STO
  • I2C_INT_ADRS
  • I2C_INT_GCS
  • I2C_INT_ARBLOS
  • I2C_INT_RXNACK
  • I2C_INT_BUSERR
  • I2C_INT_TOUT
  • I2C_INT_RXDNE
  • I2C_INT_TXDE
  • I2C_INT_RXBF
  • I2C_INT_ALL
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 259 of file ht32f5xxxx_i2c.c.

void I2C_PDMACmd ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
u32  I2C_PDMAREQ,
ControlStatus  NewState 
)

Enable or Disable the I2Cx PDMA interface.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
I2C_PDMAREQ,:specify the I2C PDMA transfer request to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • I2C_PDMAREQ_TX: Tx PDMA transfer request
  • I2C_PDMAREQ_RX: Rx PDMA transfer request
NewState,:This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 633 of file ht32f5xxxx_i2c.c.

u32 I2C_ReadRegister ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
u8  I2C_Register 
)

Read the specified I2C register and returns its value.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
I2C_Register,:specify the register to read. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • I2C_REGISTER_CR : Control Register
  • I2C_REGISTER_IER : Interrupt Enable Register
  • I2C_REGISTER_ADDR : Address Register
  • I2C_REGISTER_SR : Status Register
  • I2C_REGISTER_SHPGR : SCL High Period Generation Register
  • I2C_REGISTER_SLPGR : SCL Low Period Generation Register
  • I2C_REGISTER_DR : Data Register
  • I2C_REGISTER_TAR : Target Register
Return values:
None

Definition at line 423 of file ht32f5xxxx_i2c.c.

void I2C_SequentialFilterConfig ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
u32  Seq_Filter_Select 
)

This function is used to determine the filter glitch width of 0~2 PCLK.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
Seq_Filter_Select,:specify the glitch width of 0~2 PCLK. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
  • SEQ_FILTER_DISABLE : sequential filter is disabled
  • SEQ_FILTER_1_PCLK : filter glitch width of 1 PCLK
  • SEQ_FILTER_2_PCLK : filter glitch width of 2 PCLK
Return values:
None

void I2C_SetSCLHighPeriod ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
u32  I2C_HighPeriod 
)

Set the interval timing of the high period of the I2C clock.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
I2C_HighPeriod,:specify the high period that is to be set. This parameter must be a number between 0 and 0xFFFF.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 590 of file ht32f5xxxx_i2c.c.

void I2C_SetTimeOutPrescaler ( HT_I2C_TypeDef *  I2Cx,
u32  I2C_Prescaler 
)

This function is used to set the prescaler of I2C timeout value.

Parameters:
I2Cx,:where I2Cx is the selected I2C from the I2C peripherals.
I2C_Prescaler,:specify the I2C time out prescaler value. This parameter can be one of the following values:
  • I2C_PRESCALER_1 : I2C prescaler set to 1
  • I2C_PRESCALER_2 : I2C prescaler set to 2
  • I2C_PRESCALER_4 : I2C prescaler set to 4
  • I2C_PRESCALER_16 : I2C prescaler set to 16
  • I2C_PRESCALER_32 : I2C prescaler set to 32
  • I2C_PRESCALER_64 : I2C prescaler set to 64
  • I2C_PRESCALER_128 : I2C prescaler set to 128
Return values:
None

)

I2C_Address,:specify the slave address which will be transmitted.
I2C_Direction,:This parameter can be I2C_MASTER_READ or I2C_MASTER_WRITE.
